channel.title: Michelle Meng's Portfolio
channel.description: Recent content on Michelle Meng's Portfolio

item.title: RBC Spring Window Displays
item.description: We created a modern and compelling topiary-themed spring window display for prominent RBC locations (Plaza and Waterpark Place) to show how RBC can help people shape their goals and ideas. RBC spring window display topiary moodboard RBC Plaza Illustration RBC Waterpark Place Illustration RBC Plaza Install RBC Waterpark Place Install CD: Sara Vinten AD: Michelle Meng CW: Karishma Wadia

item.title: Zodiac Hats
item.description: Playing with mirroring patterns on Procreate to create a line of Chinese Zodiac-inspired bucket hats for a trendy fashion brand.

item.title: PC Financial - Points Tour
item.description: PC Financial wanted to find a fun way to engage the public to learn more about points and their products so we created a Beat the Shop Clock Game as a fixture of their Canada-wide points tour that gained significant traction. CD: Amy Creyer AD: Michelle Meng CW: Sarah Sheppard

item.title: Memories of Michelle
item.description: An Album Cover made in Procreate dedicated to my university graduation. This sunset captured my favorite area of Montreal, the Plateau. This brings me memories of every beginning of the semester, where I can walk around this area with my friends. I wanted to layer this on top of the letter background, as if the figure previously is staring into the sunset, which represents my fondest memories.

item.title: Simply Designed Book Covers
item.description: Using simple shapes and colours, I designed 3 covers for some of my favourite books.

item.title: Lynwood Charlton Centre
item.description: Mental health is important. Especially for our youth. Lynwood Charlton Centre (LCC) is an organization committed to bettering the mental health of our youth, but their current branding doesn’t quite connect with their audience. This is where our re-branding comes in, to tell the youth that “we are here for you” in a more fun and friendly way. AD: Michelle Meng, Ashley Park

item.title: Spotify Uncovered
item.description: Spotify loves to use data to tell you about you. And data can tell us a lot about you. But data can’t show the feelings that music evokes. Using Spotify Uncovered, you can document the music moments that data could never capture AD: Michelle Meng, Katy van Nostrand

item.title: Wendy's The Unbinging
item.description: AD: Michelle Meng CW: Deryek Sandhu, Ashley Park Due to shortage of beef for Wendy’s during COVID 19, we explored a way to target a new consumer group for Wendy’s: fitness and diet beginners. We explore the economic behaviors of Temptation Coupling and Fresh Start Effect: vaccine is coming out soon, meaning quarantine is almost over, so it’s time to start fresh and get moving in a sustainable, unbinging way.

item.title: Beyond Bumble
item.description: Finding a partner who eats like you is important in a relationship and it becomes harder if you have a restricted diet, like plant-based. This is why popular plant-based option Beyond Meat is partnering with Bumble to help connect people with similar diets. CW: Deryek Sandhu AD: Michelle Meng

item.title: Magik Soda Concept
item.description: The brand “Magik Soda” comes from the word “magic”, as this line of soft drink is inspired by the idea of “magic potions”. Hence the unique glass bottle shapes, and the colour changing flavours induced by the juice capsules. The names of each of the flavours were inspired by times of the day: “Sunrise Waves”, “Midday Watermelon” and “Sunset Dreams”. Sunrise Waves Midday Watermelon Sunset Dreams Promotional Campaign

item.title: Walkers
item.description: Walkers wanted to help young adults cope with stress through humour and social media. We created the It’s Ok to Potato campaign to tell hustling and stressed young adults that it’s OK to be a couch potato once in a while. AD: Michelle Meng CW: Sarah Sheppard

item.title: Netflix: Streaming with Strangers
item.description: The new normal is staying at home, and it can get a bit lonely. Now Netflix lets you stream with strangers without any of the dangers.

item.title: Dog Car Concept
item.description: Combining “Dog” and “Car” comes up with thousands of possibilities in my imagination. Below are three ideas that popped into my head as I contemplated these two words: Mini Dalmatian Cooper “Mini Dalmatian Cooper” that is perfect for dog lovers who want a unique touch to a mini cooper: Woofer Application “Woofer Application” an in-city rideshare that is convenient for dog lovers to request rides for their dogs: Smart Shiba Car “Smart Shiba Car” an upstanding Shiba that transforms into a smart car with a push of a button:

item.title: wUfber
item.description: Since the pandemic, over 280, 000 dogs found new homes. But now with everyone going back to work, including Uber drivers, what happens to the dogs all alone at home? We created a new feature that lets Uber drivers bring their dogs to work and lets Uber riders experience the joy of riding with two best friends. This is Wufber. AD: Michelle Meng, Ashley Park CW: Mnrupe Virk

item.title: Women Empowerment Posters
item.description: This was a series of posters for the Women Empowerment Expo in Shanghai in 2015. These posters explore the themes of self identity as females individuals and the themes of the complexity of the female mind. He For She Poster The first poster explores the representation of the female and male mind alike with the colorful blocks each meaning “feelings”, “rationality”, etc. This poster is signaling men and women alike supporting the empowerment of women.

item.title: Touchland Palm Reader
item.description: To prove to the world that there is a way to sanitize without harsh chemicals harming your hands, Touchland reads your palms’ cracked, dry past, and enlightens you with hydrating scents designed to be better care for your hands. AD: Michelle Meng CW: Sarah Sheppard

item.title: L'Oreal Soy Cycle App Concept
item.description: This was an application made for the 2019 L’Oreal Brandstorm competition. Our team researched for a biodegradable material that could replace the current plastic production, and we came across: Soy Plastic. From then on, our whole case competition is built on branding the concept of switching to soy plastic. Also we wanted the consumer to adopt the behavior of recycling product plastic within the Garnier L’Oreal ecosystem, to finally replace all plastic that they use to Soy plastic.

item.title: Netflix & Nom
item.description: One of our favorite evening rituals is watching Netflix, while munching on something. Introducing Netflix & Nom, the duo you didn’t think you need in your night routine. Loading...
